doc.title: China Minsheng Baking - H
doc.source_uri: 2026-12-31/China Minsheng Banking - H First Take 2Q25 results profit contraction continues with a slight deterioration in asset qua_2026-12-31

passages.text: First Take: 2Q25 results - profit contraction continues with a slight deterioration in asset quality

Our First Take: 2Q25 results a slight miss. Profits contracted by \(4\%\) y/y in 2Q (vs \(- 5\%\) y/y in 1Q), missing our estimates by 2ppt. Key negatives include: NIM contraction of - 4bps q/q, sequential loan and deposit contraction, and a slight deterioration in asset quality. The NPL and SML ratios picked up by 2bps/3bps q/q, NPL formation ratio increased by 24bps y/y to \(1.51\%\) , while Minsheng's NPL coverage ratio (i.e.: \(145\%\) at 2Q) remained the weakest among peers. On the positive side, the capital ratio slightly improved, and robust non- NII growth helped to support revenue growth ( \(8\%\) y/y in 2Q, the highest level since 2Q20). We expect the share price to react neutral to slightly negative to this set of results given the slow business growth and weakening asset quality.

- Robust non-NII: Non-NII grew by \(37\%\) y/y in 2Q. This is driven by robust non-fee income \((+93\%\) y/y) and improving fee growth \((+5\%\) y/y, compared to \(-4\%\) y/y in 1Q). On a semi-annual basis, fee income growth was flat q/q, mainly supported by settlement fees and custodian fees, while bank card fees and agency fees remain weak. See Table 4 for detailed trends.

- Capital position slightly improved with stable dividend payout: The CET1 ratio slightly improved by 16bps q/q to \(9.50\%\) . The CET1 ratio was 175bps higher than D-SIB requirements of \(7.75\%\) . 1H25 dividend payout ratio was \(30\%\) , compared to the FY24 payout ratio of \(30\%\) (or 1H24 payout ratio of \(28\%\) ).

- NIM contracted by 4bps q/q in 2Q, compared to +2bps q/q NIM expansion in 1Q: On a semi-annual basis, NIM contracted by 2bps h/h. Please refer to Table 3 for details. During the analyst briefing management attributed the sequential NIM contraction in 2Q to declining assets yields amid rising competition among peers.

- Asset quality slightly deteriorated: The NPL ratio increased 2bps q/q to \(1.48\%\) and the SML ratio edged up 3bps q/q to \(2.72\%\) . The NPL coverage ratio slightly trended up 1ppt to \(145\%\) , remaining the weakest among JSBs. The NPL formation ratio was \(1.51\%\) in 1H25, increasing from \(1.49\%\) in FY24 or \(1.27\%\) in 1H24. On a semi-annual basis, the corporate NPL ratio dropped by 5bps h/h, mainly driven by the real estate sector (-152bps h/h). The retail NPL ratio picked up by 9bps h/h, led by credit card loans (+40bps h/h). See Table 7 for details. During the analyst briefing, management disclosed new NPL formation is mainly coming from SME and retail loans, while management expects overall asset quality to be stable in 2H25.
1988. HK, 1988 HK Price: HK\\$4.44 29 Aug 2025 Price Target: HK\\$4.65 PT End Date: 31 Dec 2026

See page 7 for analyst certification and important disclosures, including non- US analyst disclosures. J.P. Morgan does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.

- Loans and deposits balance saw sequential contraction in 2Q: Minsheng's loans and deposits balance contracted by \(1\%\) and \(1\%\) q/q respectively in 2Q, compared to system loans and deposits growth of \(+1.2\%\) and \(+1.6\%\) q/q in 2Q. On a semi-annual basis, the deposits balance grew by \(1\%\) h/h, with a \(-1\%\) h/h contraction in corporate deposit, and \(+6\%\) h/h growth in retail deposits. In comparison, loans growth was flat h/h in 1H25, with a \(6\%\) h/h increase in corporate loans and a \(-2\%\) h/h contraction in retail loans. We also note that Minsheng's SME loans growth is slowing, with some pressure on asset quality (Table 5).
- We expect downward revisions on FY25 earnings by low single percentage point.
- We expect the share price reaction to be neutral or slightly negative and Minsheng may underperform peers in the near term.

Source: MSB financial reports 1H24-1H25, J.P. Morgan estimates.

- Minsheng Bank has made notable progress in de-risking, with non-standardized assets down from \(7\%\) of assets in 2019 to \(1\%\) of assets in 2024.- We expect an acceleration in the MSE business. MSE has a higher lending yield than average loans, and we expect Minsheng to increase the unsecured portion of MSE loans, which could drive up NIM and revenue for Minsheng.- Management is conservative about business growth as macro conditions are yet to fully recover. Thus, the revenue trend could remain weak in the near term.- Weak provision level. Minsheng's NPL coverage ratio of \(145\%\) for 2024 was the weakest among banks under our coverage. This limits the bank's ability to smoothen earnings growth.

Our Dec- 26 price target of \(\mathrm{HK}\) 4.65 is based on DDM, using a cost of equity of \(12.3\%\) , a normalized ROE of \(7.6\%\) and a terminal date of 31 December 2027. We derive the valuation for the A- share first, and then apply an H- share discount of \(24\%\) for Minsheng- H. Details are summarized in the valuation table below.
Key assumptions/parameters

Source: J.P. Morgan estimates.

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid-cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
